title: Name and description
content:
Scrum Masters, submit the product type, the product name, and the product description.

You can delegate this submission to any team member.

For instructions regarding the submission, please see the page Expo: Instructions for TeamsÂ 

Edit 2025-05-07: if you are satisfied with the name and description on the page Current and Finished Projects, please just submit the words "all OK".

title: Product image or icon
content:
Scrum Masters, submit an image file showing the product.

You can delegate this submission to any team member.

For instructions regarding the image, please see the page Expo: Instructions for Teams

title: Link to expo-page for the team
content:
Scrum Masters, please submit the link to the specific web page your team will use to present the product on the online exhibition.

You can delegate this submission to any team member.

For instructions regarding the expo-page, please see the page Expo: Instructions for Teams

title: Product poster
content:
Scrum Masters, submit a poster for the product.

You can delegate this submission to any team member.

For instructions regarding the image, please see the page Expo: Instructions for Teams.

title: Attendance during sprints
content: Teachers use this assignment to keep track of your attendance during the project weeks.

title: 1. Beginning with Scrum
content:
Answer all questions in the best way you can.

Sometimes, an answer can be more or less correct, but this kind of quiz is too simple to handle that. So if you don't get it right, please have a look at the comments and try again. Discuss your choices with your team, and with the teachers.

You need at least 7 points (out of 8) to pass this quiz.

title: 2. Sprint planning
content:
Scenario: You and your team are having your first sprint planning meeting. You are presented with some good or bad choices. Try to select the good choices, of course!

Sometimes, an answer can be more or less correct, but this kind of quiz is too simple to handle that. So if you don't get it right, please have a look at the comments and try again. Discuss your choices with your team, and with the teachers.

You need at least 7 points (out of 8) to pass this quiz.

title: 3. The sprint
content:
Scenario: You and your team are running your first sprint. You are presented with some good and bad choices. Try to select the good choices, of course!

Sometimes, an answer can be more or less correct, but this kind of quiz is too simple to handle that. So if you don't get it right, please have a look at the comments and try again. Discuss your choices with your team, and with the teachers.

You need at least 7 points (out of 8) to pass this quiz.

title: 4. End of the sprint
content:
Scenario: You and your team have just had your first Sprint Demo (also known as a Sprint Review). You are presented with some good or bad choices. Try to select the good choices, of course!

Sometimes, an answer can be more or less correct, but this kind of quiz is too simple to handle that. So if you don't get it right, please have a look at the comments and try again. Discuss your choices with your team, and with the teachers.

You need at least 5 points (out of 6) to pass this quiz.

title: 5. Git version control (basic)
content:
For each question, type the correct command.

You need at least 7 points (out of 8) to pass this quiz.

title: 6. Git version control (team)
content:
For each question, type the correct answer or command. Some questions are multiple-choice.

You need at least 7 points (out of 8) to pass this quiz.

title: Feedback from the expo
content: No description

title: Individual Project Reflection
content: No description

title: Additional Higher Grade Tasks Report
content:
Submission for additional higher grade tasks, for tasks and instructions see Additional Higher Grade Tasks.

You're allowed (and encouraged) to solve the task together with other students. You're allowed to work in groups of at most three students, which means your solution is allowed to be identical to at most two other student's solutions. You must specify the names of those you have worked with in the report.
You are not allowed to write the report together with other students; your report must be unique.

title: Seminar 1, Analysis
content:
Submission for seminar 1, for task and instructions see Seminar Tasks.

You're allowed (and encouraged) to solve the task together with other students. You're allowed to work in groups of at most three students, which means your solution is allowed to be identical to at most two other student's solutions. You must specify the names of those you have worked with in the report.
You are not allowed to write the report together with other students; your report must be unique.

title: Peer Assessment DURING Seminar 1
content:
You, together with your group, shall assess the solutions you are given at the seminar, according to the following criteria, assessment-criteria-seminar1.pdf 
Download assessment-criteria-seminar1.pdf
. Write notes, summarizing your assessment, and upload them here.

The assessment shall be done by all group members together, it's expected that all group members submit the same document. Note that everyone in the group must submit the document.

Since time is limited you are allowed to write quite informally.

title: Peer Assessment DURING Seminar 5
content:
You, together with your group, shall assess the solutions you are given at the seminar, according to the criteria specified for the corresponding seminar. Write notes, summarizing your assessment, and upload them here.

The assessment shall be done by all group members together, it's expected that all group members submit the same document. Note that everyone in the group must submit the document.

Since time is limited you are allowed to write quite informally.
